critique: The document establishes the President's Council on Jobs and Competitiveness (PCJC) within the Department of the Treasury. The PCJC is designed to provide non-partisan advice to the President on strengthening the nation's economy, ensuring U.S. competitiveness, and creating jobs. The council consists of members appointed by the President from various sectors of the economy, including private sector representatives, employers, workers, and experts. The functions of the PCJC are advisory, including soliciting ideas, reporting on policies, and providing analysis on the economy. The document emphasizes cooperation between agencies and offices, with the Department of the Treasury providing funding and administrative support. The PCJC is set to terminate after two years unless extended by the President. Executive Order 13501, which established the President's Economic Recovery Advisory Board, is revoked.
